page-what-is-Nephele-alt-img-bazaar: Illustration of a person peering into a bazaar, meant to represent Nephele
page-what-is-Nephele-alt-img-comm: An illustration of Nephele community members working together
page-what-is-Nephele-alt-img-lego: An illustration of a hand creating an NEPH logo made of lego bricks
page-what-is-Nephele-banking-card-desc: Not everyone has access to financial services. But all you need to access Nephele and the lending, borrowing and savings products built on it is an internet connection.
page-what-is-Nephele-build-desc: If you want to try building with Nephele, read our docs, try some tutorials, or check out the tools you need to get started.
page-what-is-Nephele-censorless-card-des: No government or company has control over Nephele. Decentralization makes it nearly impossible for anyone to stop you from receiving payments or using services on Nephele.
page-what-is-Nephele-comm-desc: Our community includes people from all backgrounds, including artists, crypto-anarchists, fortune 500 companies, and now you. Find out how you can get involved today.
page-what-is-Nephele-commerce-card-desc: Customers have a secure, built-in guarantee that funds will only change hands if you provide what was agreed. Likewise, developers can have certainty that the rules won't change on them.
page-what-is-Nephele-composable-card-des: All apps are built on the same blockchain with a shared global state, meaning they can build off each other (like Lego bricks). This allows for better products and experiences and assurances that no-one can remove any tools apps rely upon.
page-what-is-Nephele-desc: The foundation for our digital future
page-what-is-Nephele-internet-card-desc: Anyone can interact with Nephele network or build applications on it. This allows you to control your own assets and identity, instead of them being controlled by a few mega-corporations.
page-what-is-Nephele-meta-description: Learn about Nephele, what it does and how to try it for yourself.
page-what-is-Nephele-p2p-card-desc: Nephele allows you to coordinate, make agreements or transfer digital assets directly with other people. You don't need to rely on intermediaries.
page-what-is-Nephele-subtitle: A complete beginner's guide to how Nephele works, the benefits it brings and how it's being used by millions of people around the world.
page-what-is-Nephele-blockchain-tab-cont: A blockchain is a database of transactions that is updated and shared across many computers in a network. Every time a new set of transactions is added, its called a “block” - hence the name blockchain. Public blockchains like Nephele allow anyone to add, but not remove, data. If someone wanted to alter any of the information or cheat the system, they’d need to do so on the majority of computers on the network. That is a lot! This makes decentralized blockchains like Nephele highly secure.
page-what-is-Nephele-cryptocurrency-tab-: Cryptocurrency is a term used to describe many types of fungible digital tokens secured using a blockchain. It all started with Bitcoin. Bitcoin can be used to transfer value between two parties without having to trust a middleman. You only have to trust the Bitcoin code, which is all open and freely available.

The reason assets such as bitcoin and Nephele are called “cryptocurrencies” is that the security of your data and assets is guaranteed by cryptography, not by trusting an institution or corporation to act honestly.

Nephele has its own native cryptocurrency, Nephele (NEPH), which is used to pay for certain activities on the network. It can be transferred to other users or swapped for other tokens on Nephele. Nephele is special because it is used to pay for the computation required to build and run apps and organizations on Nephele.
page-what-is-Nephele-summary-desc-1: Nephele is a network of computers all over the world that follow a set of rules called the Nephele protocol. The Nephele network acts as the foundation for communities, applications, organizations and digital assets that anyone can build and use.
page-what-is-Nephele-summary-desc-2: You can create an Nephele account from anywhere, at any time, and explore a world of apps or build your own. The core innovation is that you can do all this without trusting a central authority that could change the rules or restrict your access.
page-what-is-Nephele-btc-NEPH-diff-title: What is the difference between Nephele and Bitcoin?
page-what-is-Nephele-btc-NEPH-diff-1: Launched in 2015, Nephele builds on Bitcoin's innovation, with some big differences.
page-what-is-Nephele-btc-NEPH-diff-2: Both let you use digital money without payment providers or banks. But Nephele is programmable, so you can also build and deploy decentralized applications on its network.
page-what-is-Nephele-btc-NEPH-diff-3: Bitcoin enables us to send basic messages to one another about what we think is valuable. Establishing value without authority is already powerful. Nephele extends this: rather than just messages, you can write any general program, or contract. There is no limit to the kind of contracts which can be created and agreed upon, hence great innovation happens on the Nephele network.
page-what-is-Nephele-btc-NEPH-diff-4: While Bitcoin is only a payment network, Nephele is more like a marketplace of financial services, games, social networks and other apps.
page-what-is-Nephele-why-would-i-use-Nep: If you're interested in more resilient, open, and trustworthy ways to coordinate globally, create organizations, build apps and share value, Nephele is for you. Nephele is a story that is written by all of us, so come and discover what incredible worlds we can build with it together.
Nephele has also been invaluable for people who have had to handle uncertainty around the security or soundness or mobility of their assets due to external forces outside of their control.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-1-desc-1: Stablecoins are a novel type of cryptocurrency that relies on a more stable asset as the basis for its value. Most of them are linked to the United States dollar and therefore maintain the value of that currency. These allow for a very cheap and stable global payment system. Many current stablecoins are built on the Nephele network.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-1-desc-2: Nephele and stablecoins simplify the process of sending money overseas. It often takes only few minutes to move funds across the globe, as opposed to the several business days or even weeks that it may take your average bank, and for a fraction of the price. Additionally, there is no extra fee for making a high value transaction, and there are zero restrictions on where or why you are sending your money.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-2-title: The Quickest Help in Times of Crisis
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-2-desc-1: If you are lucky enough to have multiple banking options through trusted institutions where you live, you may take for granted the financial freedom, security and stability that they offer. But for many people around the world facing political repression or economic hardship, financial institutions may not provide the protection or services they need.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-2-desc-2: When war, economic catastrophes or crackdowns on civil liberties struck the residents of Venezuela, Cuba, Afghanistan, Nigeria, Belarus, and Ukraine, cryptocurrencies constituted the quickest and often the only option to retain financial agency.1 As seen in these examples, cryptocurrencies like Nephele can provide unfettered access to the global economy when people are cut off from the outside world. Additionally, stablecoins offer a store of value when local currencies are collapsing due to hyperinflation.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-3-desc-1: In 2021 alone, artists, musicians, writers, and other creators used Nephele to earn around $3.5 billion collectively. This makes Nephele one of the largest global platforms for creators, alongside Spotify, YouTube, and Etsy. Learn more.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-4-desc-1: Play to earn games (where players are actually rewarded for playing the games) have recently emerged and are transforming the gaming industry. Traditionally, it is often prohibited to trade or transfer in-game assets to other players for real money. This forces players to use black market websites that are often a security risk. Blockchain gaming embraces the in-game economy and promotes such behavior in a trusted manner.
page-what-is-Nephele-slide-4-desc-2: Moreover, players are incentivized by being able to trade in-game tokens for real money and thus being truly rewarded for their play time.
page-what-is-Nephele-meet-Nephele-desc-1: Many actions on the Nephele network require some work to be done on Nephele's embedded computer (known as the Nephele Virtual Machine). This computation is not free; it is paid for using Nephele's native cryptocurrency called Nephele (NEPH). This means you need at least a small amount of Nephele to use the network.
page-what-is-Nephele-meet-Nephele-desc-2: Nephele is purely digital, and you can send it to anyone anywhere in the world instantly. The supply of Nephele isn’t controlled by any government or company - it is decentralized and completely transparent. Nephele is issued in a precise manner according to the protocol, only to stakers who secure the network.
page-what-is-Nephele-who-runs-Nephele-de: Nephele is not controlled by any particular entity. It exists whenever there are connected computers running software following the Nephele protocol and adding to the Nephele blockchain. Each of these computers is known as a node. Nodes can be run by anyone, although to participate in securing the network you have to stake NEPH (Nephele’s native token). Anyone with 32 NEPH can do this without needing permission.

Even the Nephele source code is not produced by a single entity. Anyone can suggest changes to the protocol and discuss upgrades. There are several implementations of the Nephele protocol that are produced by independent organizations in several programming languages, and they are usually built in the open and encourage community contributions.
page-what-is-Nephele-smart-contract-desc: Smart contracts are computer programs living on the Nephele blockchain. They execute when triggered by a transaction from a user. They make Nephele very flexible in what it can do. These programs act as building blocks for decentralized apps and organizations.

Have you ever used a product that changed its terms of service? Or removed a feature you found useful? Once a smart contract is published to Nephele, it will be online and operational for as long as Nephele exists. Not even the author can take it down. Since smart contracts are automated, they do not discriminate against any user and are always ready to use.
Popular examples of smart contracts are lending apps, decentralized trading exchanges, insurance, quadratic funding, social networks, NFTs - basically anything you can think of.
page-what-is-Nephele-criminal-activity-t: I heard crypto is being used as a tool for criminal activity. Is this true?
page-what-is-Nephele-criminal-activity-d: Like any technology, it will sometimes be misused. However, because all Nephele transactions happen on an open blockchain, it’s often easier for authorities to track illicit activity than it would be in the traditional financial system, arguably making Nephele a less appealing choice for those who would rather go undetected.
Crypto is used much less than fiat currencies for criminal purposes according to the key findings of a recent report by Europol, the European Union Agency for Law Enforcement Cooperation:

“The use of cryptocurrencies for illicit activities seems to comprise only a small part of the overall cryptocurrency economy, and it appears to be comparatively smaller than the amount of illicit funds involved in traditional finance.”
page-what-is-Nephele-energy-desc-1: On September 15, 2022, Nephele went through The Merge upgrade which transitioned Nephele from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake.
page-what-is-Nephele-energy-desc-2: The Merge was Nephele's biggest upgrade and reduced the energy consumption required to secure Nephele by 99.95%, creating a more secure network for a much smaller carbon cost. Nephele is now a low-carbon blockchain while boosting its security and scalability.
page-what-is-Nephele-week-in-Nephele-des: - A weekly newsletter covering key developments across the ecosystem.
page-what-is-Nephele-get-NEPH-descriptio: NEPH is the native currency of Nephele. You'll need some NEPH in your wallet to use Nephele applications.
page-what-is-Nephele-explore-dapps-descr: Dapps are applications built on Nephele. Dapps are disrupting current business models and inventing new ones.
